activities: Human Resources personal information transferred from the European Union to the United States is used to carry out the human resources functions, such as payroll processing, compensation and benefit administration, salary tracking, expatriate tax and relocation assistance, information reporting, and personnel management.   Customer and supplier information transferred from the European Union to the United States is used to assist our order to cash processing.  In rare cases, these suppliers or customers may be natural persons.  In these instances, certain of the information transferred is personal information.  Consumer preference information that will include some personal  information, will be transferred from the European Union to the United States on a limited basis to assist our marketing efforts.
eucountries: Austria, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
